alert.note: Alert for District of Columbia (District of Columbia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 5:05PM EDT until August 14 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR THE CENTRAL DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, THE CITY OF ALEXANDRIA AND THE CITY OF FALLS CHURCH AND WEST CENTRAL PRINCE GEORGES, ARLINGTON AND EAST CENTRAL FAIRFAX COUNTIES... At 505 PM EDT, emergency management reported flash flooding in Springfield and Alexandria. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported several closed roads and water rescues in Springfield and Alexandria. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Arlington... Alexandria... Bethesda... Annandale... Vienna... Falls Church... Huntington... Coral Hills... Mantua... Pimmit Hills... National Harbor... Rosslyn... Crystal City... Reagan National Airport... Nationals Park... Oakton... Lincolnia... Tysons Corner... Camp Springs... Oxon Hill... This includes the following Flood Prone Roads: Military Road at 36th Road at Gulf Branch... 18th Street at Upton Street... 17th Street North at North Buchanan St... South Troy Street near Long Branch... West Street near Braddock Road... Holmes Run Below Lake Barcroft... FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Basement flooding can occur quickly and create a life-threatening situation. If you are in a basement, or a residence below street level, move to a higher floor immediately.
